sen.e: According to an epic "Esshu gunki" (an epic of the Asakura clan in Echizen Province), he was Emperor Kaika's descendent, while according to "Asakura Shimatsuki" (History of the Asakura family), he was Emperor Kotoku's descendent.

sen.cmt: he→the clan,the を補いました。according to→states that と修正しました。『越州軍記』、朝倉始末記』の定訳は共に確認できておりません。

sen.j: 室町時代には朝倉敏景（英林孝景）が守護代甲斐常治とともに主である斯波義敏と対立し、足利将軍家の家督争いなどから発展した応仁の乱では山名持豊(宗全)率いる西軍から細川勝元率いる東軍に属し、越前から甲斐氏を追う。
sen.e: During the Muromachi Period, Toshikage ASAKURA (Eirin Takakage) was opposed to his lord Yoshitoshi SHIBA with Tsuneharu KAI, and in the Onin War, which broke out from the internal squabble of the Ashikaga Shogun family over the family reign, he switched from the West squad lead by Mochitoyo YAMANA (Sozen) to the East squad lead by Katsumoto HOSOKAWA, and he expelled the Kai clan from Echizen Province.

During the Muromachi period, Toshikage ASAKURA (Eirin Takakage) came to oppose his lord Yoshitoshi SHIBA with Tsuneharu KAI, and in the Onin War, which broke out from the internal squabble of the Ashikaga Shogun family over the family reign, he switched from the West army lead by Mochitoyo YAMANA (Sozen) to the East army lead by Katsumoto HOSOKAWA, and he expelled the Kai clan from Echizen Province.
sen.cmt: Period→period,was opposed to→came to oppose,squad→army,スペースを修正しました。
sen.e: During the Muromachi period, Toshikage ASAKURA (Eirin Takakage) came to oppose his lord Yoshitoshi SHIBA with Tsuneharu KAI, and in the Onin War, which broke out from the internal squabble of the Ashikaga Shogun family over the family reign, he switched from the West army lead by Mochitoyo YAMANA (Sozen) to the East army lead by Katsumoto HOSOKAWA, and he expelled the Kai clan from Echizen Province.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 朝倉孝景は越前国守護に取り立てられ一乗谷城に拠った。
sen.e: Takakage ASAKURA was preferentially given the post of Shugo (military governor) in Echizen Province and took the Ichijodani Castle as his headquarters.
sen.cmt: 朝倉孝景→Takakage ASAKURAは、 上列の朝倉敏景（英林孝景）→Toshikage ASAKURA (Eirin Takakage)と同一人物か不明です。
sen.e: Takakage ASAKURA was promoted to the Shugo (military governor) in Echizen Province and took the Ichijodani Castle as his headquarters.

sen.j: 孝景は分国法である『朝倉敏景十七ヶ条』を制定した。
sen.e: Takakage set up bunkokuho (an autonomous law that individual sengoku daimyo enforced in their own domain of provincial control) called "The seventeen articles of Toshikage ASAKURA."
sen.cmt: 分国法→定訳不明：bunkokuho (an autonomous law that individual sengoku daimyo enforced in their own domain of provincial control)としました。 『朝倉敏景十七ヶ条』→"The seventeen articles of Toshikage ASAKURA"としました。

sen.j: 旧主の斯波義敏が越前守護職を回復せんと、朝倉氏の越前実効支配について幕府に異議を申し立てる。
sen.e: The former lord of the province, Yoshitoshi SHIBA brought to the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) an objection about the Asakura clan's practical rule over the Echizen Province, in order to recover the post of Shugo (military governor) of Echizen Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The former lord of the province, Yoshitoshi SHIBA brought to the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) an objection about the Asakura clan's effective control over Echizen Province, in order to recover the post of Shugo (military governor) of Echizen Province.
sen.cmt: スペースを修正しました。practical rule→effective control と修正しました。the を削除しました。
sen.e: The former lord of the province, Yoshitoshi SHIBA brought to the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) an objection about the Asakura clan's effective control over Echizen Province, in order to recover the post of Shugo (military governor) of Echizen Province.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: すると、かつての守護斯波義廉の子を鞍谷氏の養子として足利義俊と名乗らせた上で、幕府の反対を押し切ってこの義俊を”名目上越前国主”として擁立し越前守護の斯波氏に対抗した。
sen.e: Takakage, therefore, forced the Kuratani clan to adopt the son of Shugo Yoshiyasu SHIBA and made the adopted son proclaim himself Yoshitoshi ASHIKAGA, and then, in order to cope with the Shiba clan, which was formal Shugo of Echizen Province, Takakage backed up Yoshitoshi as 'the nominal provincial lord of Echizen Province,' overriding resistance from the bakufu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。 守護斯波義廉→Shugo Yoshiyasu SHIBAとしました。 ”名目上越前国主”→定訳不明：'the nominal provincial lord of Echizen Province' としました。
sen.e: Takakage, therefore, forced the Kuratani clan to adopt the son of Shugo Yoshiyasu SHIBA and made the adopted son proclaim himself Yoshitoshi ASHIKAGA, and then, to oppose the Shiba clan, which was the Shugo of Echizen Province, Takakage backed up Yoshitoshi as 'the nominal provincial lord of Echizen Province,' overcoming resistance from the bakufu.
sen.cmt: ”かつてのの子”では意味が通らず、ウェブ上から”かつての守護斯波義廉の子”を補ってオリジナル部を修正しました。in order to come with→to oppose, formal→ the,overriding resistance from→overcoming resistance from と修正しました。
sen.e: Takakage, therefore, forced the Kuratani clan to adopt the son of Shugo Yoshiyasu SHIBA and made the adopted son proclaim himself Yoshitoshi ASHIKAGA, and then, to oppose the Shiba clan, which was the Shugo of Echizen Province, Takakage backed up Yoshitoshi as 'the nominal provincial lord of Echizen Province,' overcoming resistance from the bakufu.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: （鞍谷氏は、足利義持の弟、足利義嗣の子・足利嗣俊を祖とする。室町将軍家の越前における分家、鞍谷御所と呼ばれて尊崇を集めていた。）
sen.e: (The Kuratani clan's ancestor was Tsugutoshi ASHIKAGA, who was the son of Yoshitsugu ASHIKAGA and smaller brother of Yoshimochi ASHIKAGA, and it was highly respected as a branch family called Kuratani gosho (Kuratani Palace) of the Muromachi Shogunate family in Echizen Province.

sen.j: のちに朝倉氏自体が越前守護に任じられることとなったため、鞍谷公方足利氏は朝倉氏の客将と化し、朝倉氏が名実ともに同国の大名となった。
sen.e: Later, as the Asakura clan itself was appointed Echizen shugo (military governor of Echizen Province), Kuratani kubo Ashikaga clan ended as a guest shogun of the Asakura clan, and the Asakura clan became the daimyo (territorial lord) of the province in name and in reality.

sen.cmt: to, the を補いました。ended as→became と修正しました。「客将」の定訳は確認できておりません。しかし、ここでの”将軍”は意味が通らないと思い、shogun→commander と修正しました。
sen.e: Later, as the Asakura clan itself was appointed to Echizen shugo (military governor of Echizen Province), the Kuratani kubo Ashikaga clan became a guest commander of the Asakura clan, and the Asakura clan became the daimyo (territorial lord) of the province in name and in reality.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 戦国時代には越前支配のみならず、隣国若狭国、近江国にも進攻し、領土を広げたが、尾張国の織田信長と対立し、1573年、滅ぼされた。
sen.e: During the Sengoku Period (period of warring states), the clan not only establish the dominance in Echizen Province, but also extended its territory over the neighboring provinces, Wakasa and Omi, but the confrontation with Nobunaga ODA of Owari Province lead the clan to destruction in 1573.

sen.cmt: カッコ内を修正しました。establish→established,lead→led,destruction→fall と修正しました。
sen.e: During the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States), the clan not only established the dominance in Echizen Province, but also extended its territory over the neighboring provinces, Wakasa and Omi, but the confrontation with Nobunaga ODA of Owari Province led the clan to fall in 1573.

sen.j: 備後国の鞆の浦にいた足利義昭（実質的には毛利氏）に頼り朝倉家を再興しようと奔走した朝倉宮増丸、及び家督後継者と擬せられていた朝倉景忠がいるが、中国戦線の悪化により不成功に終わった。
sen.e: Another story tells about Miyamasumaru (宮増丸) ASAKURA, who scrambled for rebuilding the Asakura family depending on Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA (in reality depending on the Mori clan) who was stationed at Tomonoura in Bingo Province, as well as Kagetada ASAKURA, who was falsely presumed to be the successor to the family reign, and according to the story, their attempt was failed due to the deteriorated war situation at the Chinese front.
